column1: Which legendary pass rusher coined the term "sack"?
column7: Jones popularized the term, but sacks didn't become an official stat until after he retired.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in interceptions?
column7: Krause recorded 81 interceptions during his career, playing for Washington and Minnesota.

column1: Which quarterback has the most regular season losses of all time?
column7: The journeyman Testaverde lost over 120 games while playing for half a dozen teams.

column1: Which QB has had the most interceptions returned for a touchdown?
column7: The Gunslinger of Gunslingers, Favre had 32 pick-sixes in his career.

column1: Who was on the cover of the first ever game in the Madden series?
column7: Named after the legend coach and commentator, John Madden Football was first released in 1988.

column1: Which NFL team name does NOT refer to a horse?
column7: Houston's expansion team was almost named the Stallions, however.

column1: Who was the first draft pick of the new Cleveland Browns in 1999?
column7: A college star in Kentucky's air raid offense, Couch never successfully transitioned to the pro game.

column1: Who was the first draft pick in Jacksonville Jaguars history?
column7: The Jags drafted Boselli in 1995. His career was ultimately cut short, but his dominant prime eventually got him into the Hall of Fame.

column1: Who is the all time leader in sacks?
column7: Smith recorded 200 sacks in his career, 171 of which came while playing for the Bills.

column1: Who was the first quarterback to throw for over 5000 yards in a season?
column7: Marino threw for 5,084 yards in 1984. His single season record was not broken until 2011.

column1: Who was the first quarterback to throw for 50 touchdowns in a season?
column7: Brady threw for 50 TDs in 2007, leading the Patriots to a perfect 16-0 record in the regular season.

column1: Who was the first draft pick in Baltimore Ravens history in 1996?
column7: The Ravens selected Odgen 4th overall. Lewis was added to the roster later in the first round.

column1: Which head coach has the most regular season wins?
column7: Shula's 328 regular season wins still top the list, but an update may yet be needed with Belichick closing in.

column1: Which team has its logo on only one side of the helmet?
column7: What started as an experiment by former owner Art Rooney became a tradition that has continued to this day.

column1: Who was the last non-quarterback to win the Most Valuable Player award?
column7: Peterson rushed for 2,097 yards during the 2012 season, beating out Peyton Manning for the MVP award.

column1: Which team drafted John Elway first overall in 1983?
column7: The Colts drafted Elway, but he refused to play for Baltimore and was traded to Denver the following week.

column1: In addition to St. Louis and Los Angeles, which city has the Rams played for?
column7: The Cleveland Rams played in the NFL from 1937 to 1945, after which the team moved to Los Angeles.

column1: Which state is Arrowhead Stadium located in?
column7: The stadium is on the Missouri side of the Kansas-Missouri border, as is most of the Kansas City metro area.

column1: Who was the starting QB for the Broncos in week 12 of the 2020 season?
column7: The Broncos ran out of QBs due to covid protocols, and the former college QB went 1/9 for 13 yards and 2 interceptions.

column1: Which team has a mascot named "Poe"?
column7: The mascot is named after Edgar Allan Poe, the author of the classic poem "The Raven".

column1: Who missed the tackle on the final play of the Minneapolis Miracle?
column7: Stefon Diggs scored a long walk-off touchdown after Williams whiffed on the tackle in the 2017 playoffs.

column1: How high was Saquon Barkley drafted in 2018?
column7: The Giants passed on QBs Sam Darnold, Josh Allen and Josh Rosen to pick the talented RB.

column1: Which team drafted Brett Favre?
column7: The Falcons selected Favre early in the 2nd round of the 1991 draft.

column1: Who was the Offensive Rookie of the Year in 2001?
column7: The Bears RB rushed for nearly 1,200 yards to beat out Tomlinson for the award.

column1: Who was the Offensive Rookie of the Year in 2006?
column7: The electric Titans QB captured the award despite throwing for more interceptions than touchdowns.

column1: Who has scored the most points in NFL history?
column7: Vinatieri surpassed Andersen in 2018 to set the new record.

column1: Which team did Jay Cutler not play for in his career?
column7: Cutler spent his college years in Nashville with Vanderbilt, but never played for the Titans.

column1: Which player was known as the "Human Joystick"?
column7: The diminutive but extremely agile Hall scored a total of 12 return touchdowns in his career.

column1: How many Super Bowls did Troy Aikman win in his career?
column7: Aikman was the quarterback for the Dallas Cowboys during their dynasty years in the 1990s.

column1: Which coach famously said that "you are what your record says you are"?
column7: Parcells' record as a head coach in the NFL was 172-130-1.

column1: Who was the last QB to make the Pro Bowl playing for the Browns?
column7: Anderson made the Pro Bowl after throwing 29 touchdowns (and 19 interceptions) in 2007.

column1: Which player was known as the "Law Firm"?
column7: The running back with the unusually lengthy name rushed for over 1,000 yards twice in his career.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in receptions?
column7: The legendary Rice caught 1,549 balls in his career, the bulk of them playing for the 49ers.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in receiving yards?
column7: Even with the increased passing of today's game, Rice's record of 22,895 yards will be hard to beat.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in receiving touchdowns?
column7: Rice caught 197 touchdowns during his lengthy career.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in rushing yards?
column7: The Cowboys rushed for over 1,000 yards 11 seasons in a row, from 1991 to 2001.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in rushing touchdowns?
column7: Smith only missed 14 games in his 15-year career, playing primarily for the Cowboys.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in non-offensive touchdowns?
column7: Hester had a total of 20 return TDs in his career: 14 from punts, 5 from kickoffs and 1 from a missed field goal.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in passes intercepted?
column7: Favre was a player of high highs and low lows. His record of 336 interceptions is not currently even close to being broken.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in yards from scrimmage?
column7: Rice had 22,895 receiving yards and 645 rushing yards for a total of 23,540 yards from scrimmage in his career.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in kickoff return yards?
column7: Mitchell had 14,014 kickoff return yards in his career playing for teams within the NFC East.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in punt return yards?
column7: Mitchell is the only player to have over 4,000 punt return yards, but he fell just shy of 5,000 with 4,999 yards.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in punt return touchdowns?
column7: With 14 punt return touchdowns, Hester is arguably the best return specialist in history.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in interception return yards?
column7: Reed was always looking to get upfield after an interception, and he gained 1,590 return yards to show for it.

column1: Who is the all-time leader in interception returns for a touchdown?
column7: With 12 pick-sixes in his career, Rod Woodson was a playmaker at both cornerback and safety in his career.

column1: Which player has the most tackles for loss in the 2000s?
column7: With 202 tackles for loss in his career, Suggs often got into the backfield against both the run and the pass.

column1: Which player has the most fumbles forced in the 2000s?
column7: Mathis stripped the ball with incredible efficiency, with 54 forced fumbles in his career with the Colts.

column1: Which player has the most passes defended in the 2000s?
column7: Bailey made a lot of plays on the ball, as his 203 defended passes illustrate.

column1: Who was the MVP of Tom Brady's first Super Bowl?
column7: Vinatieri kicked the game-winning field goal, but Brady's 145 passing yards were enough to win the award.

column1: Which tight end has the most receiving yards in NFL history?
column7: Gonzalez had 15,127 receiving yards in his career as a Chief and a Falcon.

column1: What percentage of Steve Young's career snaps were in shotgun?
column7: Young never took a snap from shotgun in during his career.

column1: Which round of the 2000 draft was kicker Sebastian Janikowski selected in?
column7: The Raiders picked Janikowski 17th overall. Meanwhile, one Tom Brady wasn't drafted until the end of the 6th round.

column1: Which former quarterback is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: Manning is in the College Football Hall of Fame, but his success in the NFL wasn't on the level of his sons Peyton and Eli.

column1: Which former running back is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: Taylor's 11,695 career rushing yards are currently the most by an eligible player not yet selected into the HoF.

column1: Which former wide receiver is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: Despite having nearly as many career yards as his former fellow Colt WR Marvin Harrison, Wayne is not yet in the HoF.

column1: Which former offensive guard is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: Evans was a four-time first-team All-Pro during his prime with the Saints, but is waiting for his place in the HoF.

column1: Which former offensive tackle is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: The stout right tackle's Hall of Fame case has grown stronger in recent years, but Anderson is stuck in line for now.

column1: Which former center is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: His credentials as a player have not yet been strong enough, but maybe Saturday will one day enter the HoF as a head coach?

column1: Which former defensive tackle is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: Williams was a five-time first-team All-Pro as he formed the "Williams wall" for the Vikings together with Pat Williams.

column1: Which former pass rusher is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: Allen's 136 career sacks have made him a HoF finalist multiple times, so this question might need an update sooner or later.

column1: Which former linebacker is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: Willis desided to cut his career short due to injuries, but the former 49ers built an impressive resume in only eight seasons.

column1: Which former cornerback is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: The towering Asomugha enjoyed a stretch of dominant play in Oakland, but his NFL success was ultimately rather short-lived.

column1: Which former safety is not a Pro Football Hall of Famer?
column7: Sharper had 63 interceptions in his career, but he is currently in prison for serial rape and arguably unworthy of any celebration.

column1: Who is the only punter in the Pro Football Hall of Fame?
column7: Even Guy had to bide his time: He finished his playing career in 1986 and was inducted into the Hall of Fame in 2014.

column1: What is the name of former WR Keyshawn Johnson's book?
column3: Just Give Me the Damn Ball
column6: Just Give Me the Damn Ball
column7: The memoir was written together with Shelley Smith and covers Johnson's rookie season with the struggling Jets in 1996.

column1: Which cornerback did Steve Smith advise to "Ice up, son"?
column7: The always outspoken WR's post-game comments about his matchup against Talib became an instant classic in 2013.

column1: Which member of the 2002 Buccaneers most recently got into the Hall of Fame?
column7: Barber joined his former teammates in the HoF in 2023 as the fourth member of the Bucs Super Bowl winning defense of 2002.

column1: Which quarterback was known as "Broadway Joe"?
column7: Namath was an iconic figure in his time, and enjoyed the lavish lifestyle his fame and fortune made available to him in New York.

column1: Who was the first draft pick in Houston Texans history?
column7: The Texans selected Carr with the 1st overall in the 2002 draft. The Panthers then took Julius Peppers with the 2nd pick.

column1: Which former player is known as "Prime Time"?
column7: Sanders has embraced the nickname that has followed him since high school. In 1994 he even released a rap album titled "Prime Time".

column1: How big was the lead the Falcons blew in Super Bowl LI?
column7: Tom Brady led the Patriots back from a seemingly impossible 28-3 deficit to ultimately win the game 34-28 in overtime.

column1: Which Raven missed his entire rookie year after falling down two flights of stairs?
column7: The 2nd round pick fractured his skull in the accident in 2010 and didn't play his first game until 18 months after he was drafted.

column1: Which team did Josh McCown not play for during his career
column7: McCown was a member of 12 NFL teams during his playing career, but (unlike his little brother Luke) the quarterback was never a Saint.

column1: Which team did Ryan Fitzpatrick not play for during his career?
column7: In his career, the journeyman quarterback had 9 teams â€“ but the Bears weren't one.

column1: Which former player nicknamed himself the "Amish Rifle"?
column7: The Amish Rifle was perhaps more regularly known as FitzMagic or FitzTragic, depending on the week or the season in question.

column1: How many quarterbacks were selected in the top 10 of the 2018 draft?
column7: Out of Baker Mayfield (1st), Sam Darnold (3rd), Josh Allen (7th) and Josh Rosen (10th), only Allen remains with the team that drafted him.

column1: Which team represented Baltimore from 1953 to 1983?
column7: Former owner Jim Irsay moved the Colts franchise from Baltimore to Indianapolis in the middle of the night in March of 1984.

column1: Which teams fans are known as the "Dawg Pound"?
column7: More accurately, the Dawg Pound is the name of the bleacher section behind Cleveland Browns Stadium's east end zone.

column1: Which team is known as the "Green Gang"?
column7: The Jets' team colors are officially called Gotham green, spotlight white and stealth black.

column1: Which player was known as "Muscle Hamster"?
column7: Standing at 5'9" but at times weighing in at over 220 pounds, Muscle Hamster certainly packed a punch.

column1: Which NFL team has Pete Carroll not coached?
column7: Carroll did work in Los Angeles from 2001 to 2009, but as the head coach of college football's USC Trojans.

column1: Who was the MVP of Super Bowl XLVIII?
column7: Smith had a 69-yard pick-six and he also recovered a fumble as the Seahawks stomped the Broncos 43-8.

column1: Who played the entire 2017 AFC Championship game with a torn ACL?
column7: Rivers gutted it out, but the Chargers ultimately got eliminated by the Patriots for the second year in a row.

column1: Which team plays its games at the league's northern-most stadium?
column7: This may feel like a trick question, as Lumen Field rarely sees similar extreme weather as some of the other northern stadiums.

column1: Who was the Patriots starting quarterback before Tom Brady?
column7: Months after signing a 100 million dollar extension, Bledsoe got injured in week 2 of the 2001 season. He never got back his job as starter.

column1: Who has played the most games in NFL history?
column7: The kicker originally from Denmark played in the NFL from 1982 to 2007. He officially retired in 2008, at the seasoned age of 47.

column1: Who was the first head coach in Houston Texans history?
column7: Capers lasted in Houston for four seasons, but did not have a winning record in any of them, going 18-46 overall.
